item.title: [DISTRELEC-6659] SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999
item.description:
Department Code "9999":
This will be the value for the Webshop to recognize that the contact person should is deactivated
http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/ERP+Codelist+-+DistDepartment

If we get the DistDepartment Code 9999 from SAP we should deactivate the contact.

If a deactivated contact person tries to login we should display the message" Your account is locked, please contact our customer care team" and in German "Ihr Zugang ist gesperrt, bitte wenden sie sich an unseren Kundendienst“
item.summary: SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate, thx.

This approach is not the correct one. It does not make sense to deactivate a customer according to his/her department code. The soap response form SAP should contain a boolean flag saying the contact is active or not.

Is it possible that you implement some kind of Flag on SAP-side which is set when departement code 9999 is applied on the contact. We'll check this flag then from Webshop-side. What would be the impact?

Hello Rafael,
As we discussed this means a change on the read customer interface by adding one more field. The current solution needs to change and has been already implemented from our side. Please let me know how we will proceed
We will implement the "9999" dpt. code solution because of less efforts from SAP side. Otherwise the interface needs a CR.

Using the flag "active" only is not enough because even if the contact is not active he/she can still login in hybris. However, to disable the login, we need to set the flag "Login disabled" to true and the "Activated with Double Opt-In" to false. In this way we ensure that this contact will not be able to login in the future.

One main problem is if a contact has been deactivated in SAP but not yet in hybris, then we have the following scenarios:

  1. If the customer is B2C, then the contact will be able to login the first time but updated as deactivated in hybris. Next time he wont be able to login.
  2. If the customer is B2B:
  • If the deactivated contact isis the first one who logs in after the deactivation, here we have the same case as 1.
  • If another, active, contact already logged in just after the deactivation of the contact, then the contact is updated in hybris and he wont be able to login anymore.

That's fine for me - Can we implement a warning-message like this:
"Sorry, your account has been deactivated. Please contact customer service: Tel: [customer-service telnumber of respective country]
Email: [cusotmer-service email of respective country]"
?
Yes this is feasible. I already implemented this logic.
fixed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6655] EX - Registration
item.description:
Requirement

  • Dropdown on top of the form, containing ALL countries from list. (See: Countries & Shipping overview)
  • Default payment methods for new customers: CreditCard, PayPal and Prepaid-Invoice (defined from SAP).
  • Implementation of a logic during the registration process based on the customer type (EU or Non EU) in relation to the country selection. Depending on selection, different fields are shown on the registration-form(VAT-ID or Organizational number) and different Transportation-methods are available to the customer. See: Delivery terms.

B2B-Specific

  • VAT-ID or Organizational number:
    • VAT-ID & Organizational number present. VAT-ID is Mandatory for EU-countries.
    • Non-EU: Only organizational number present, not mandatory. (SAP Taxnumber 2)
  • EU-Only: Warning-message on top of registration page should be shown: “Please register with a valid VAT-ID of your country if you don’t want Dutch tax being charged on your orders.”

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate, you can come back to me if something is unclear. Thx
The backend task is already in place. Assign it to FE developer.
Note: As Long as our Jira/Development process hasn't been improved, I Need to put it back to open however this Change is APPROVED
Ticket treated as prio 1 for the Elfa Rollout (in alignment with Jörg Loch), e-mail from Oana to Rafael (29.04.15)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6640] Filter selection with no results
item.description:
Hello,

In a L3 or lower category, when the "Auto-apply" function is not selected, selecting a group of facets that lead to a no result redirects you to the upper category.

This is only happening when using the navigation, If a search query is performed the shop behaves as expected.

This issue might be related to the redirect logic set up on ticket DISTRELEC-5960, which should not be apply in this case. Please rework it so that the redirection is only happening when a category is empty and not when facets are selected.

Thanks,
Laura

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please have a look after fixing DISTRELEC-6763

Hi Laura

Can you provide some examples on Q please?

Thx
Will

Hi Will

In Q is not possible to reproduce as I am assuming it can be related to the SEO 0 result redirects mentioned in the description, and this logic is probably not implemented in Q

I can only reproduce it in P, example in P:

  • On category: http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Automation/Antriebstechnik/Aktoren/c/cat-L3D_525517
    1 "Auto apply filter" is not selected
    2. Select the following filters.
    Hersteller: TDS
    Haltekraft: 40 N
    Nennleistung: 0.8W
    Nennspanung: 6VDC
    3. Click on Update result. Redirect to /c/cat-L2D_379617 (http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Automation/Antriebstechnik/c/cat-L2D_379617?q=*&filter_Buyable=1&filter_Category3=Aktoren&filter_Manufacturer=TDS&filter_Haltekraft~~N=40&filter_Nennleistung~~W=0.8&filter_Nennspannung~~VDC=6)

This happens for all categories, when the set of filter selected produce a 0 result.

-->Correct result is to display the error message without leaving the page

i hope is more clear now,

Thanks,
Laura

redirect issue:

07 Mai 2015 09:19:31 INFO  [hybrisHTTP41] [monitoring] remoteAddr = 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1, request = /de/automation/antriebstechnik/aktoren/c/cat-L3D_525517?q=*&filter_Buyable=1&filter_Category3=Aktoren&filter_Manufacturer=TDS&filter_Haltekraft%7E%7EN=40&filter_Nennleistung%7E%7EW=0.8 GET: 15362 ms, 0 Ko
07 Mai 2015 09:19:48 INFO  [hybrisHTTP42] [monitoring] remoteAddr = 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1, request = /de/automation/antriebstechnik/c/cat-L2D_379617?q=*&filter_Buyable=1&filter_Category3=Aktoren&filter_Manufacturer=TDS&filter_Haltekraft%7E%7EN=40&filter_Nennleistung%7E%7EW=0.8 GET: 16828 ms, 97 Ko

Hi Laura

This redirection I implemented because of the ticket http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5858 . Pierre wanted this feature. You need to discuss with Pierre, what is more important to show to the user. An error message or products of the super category.

Thx
Will

Please check if you can split the functionality so that the redirect is only work when you do not have filters on the query.

Thanks,
Laura
As discussed, we only redirect if there are NO filters set in the request.
Found a bug. Will implement a fix for it.
Bug is fixed. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6547] SEO - Url Rewriting - Optimization
item.description:
Observations :

  • Our url rewritting is the vanilla version of Hybris
    Example : http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Passive-Bauelemente/Widerst%C3%A4nde/SMD--und-Schichtwiderst%C3%A4nde/Metallschicht-Widerst%C3%A4nde%2C-SMD%2C-Rollenware/Pr%C3%A4zisions-Chipwiderstandsrollen-0603%2C-0-1%25%2C-%C2%B110-ppm-%C2%B0C%2C-hohe-Zuverl%C3%A4ssigkei/c/cat-205342

Impacts :

  • Lack of stability over time of the url which lead into maintenance issue (400, 500, 301...)
  • Lack of readability/maintenability of the url which lead into usability issues for Users, Spider, BI.
  • The current way doing url rewriting is almost useless.

Demands :

  • Use those convention to improve the url rewriting module of hybris on category and products url patterns in this exact order :
    • 1) lower case,
    • 2) replace accentuated char by their non accentuated equivalent
    • 3) replace stop words by space " " (stop word list per language),
    • 4) replace every non digit/alphabetical characters [a-z0-9] by a space " ",
    • 5) replace every "lonely" characters ( [a-z0-9]{1} ) by a space
    • 6) replace consecutive white space by only one space (recursively to not miss any),
    • 7) trim string,
    • 8) replace space " " by "-"
  • Example : diff
    • Before : http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Komponenten/Passive-Bauelemente/Widerst%C3%A4nde/SMD--und-Schichtwiderst%C3%A4nde/Metallschicht-Widerst%C3%A4nde%2C-SMD%2C-Rollenware/Pr%C3%A4zisions-Chipwiderstandsrollen-0603%2C-0-1%25%2C-%C2%B110-ppm-%C2%B0C%2C-hohe-Zuverl%C3%A4ssigkei/c/cat-205342
    • After : http://www.distrelec.ch/de/komponenten/passive-bauelemente/widerstande/smd-schichtwiderstande/metallschicht-widerstande-smd-rollenware/prazisions-chipwiderstandsrollen-0603-10-ppm-hohe-zuverlassigkei/c/cat-205342
  • Those rules have to be applied only on the added rewritten string.
  • Those rules are generic, other optimization idea can be proposed.

Warning :

  • Do not deploy on P url rewriting optimization without sitemap (DISTRELEC-6641), FF export and services dependencies (comment adrian) corrected rewriting functionality

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate

• Attention: Any change in the rule to create URLs need to be changed in the FF export (on Oracle SQL level) too. (see DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator.java)
  • How to handle cyrillic characters? (use RU or use EN instead)
    e.g. test.distrelec.ee/ru/Компьютеры-%26-Хобби (a link needs to be escaped like this test.distrelec.ee/ru/%D0%9A%D0%BE%D0%BC%D0%BF%D1%8C%D1%8E%D1%82%D0%B5%D1%80%D1%8B-%26-%D0%A5%D0%BE%D0%B1%D0%B1%D0%B8/c/cat-L1D_379523

Ahh I see. We have to check, whether a library already exists or the replacement has to be written by ourselves.

Making the URL "save" currently takes place here. And the logic is currently performed during each page call and during each FF export.

  • Java => de.hybris.platform.commerceservices.url.impl.AbstractUrlResolver
  • Oracle => Distrelec_FactFinderExport_UrlEncode_Function_Oracle.sql

We should consider persisting an URL conform value of the localized names of manufacturer, category and product in the database. Making the names URL conform would take place only once during the PIM import.

Solving this issue will also solve another problem with the russian URLs (length is too long). see DISTRELEC-6551
Please check on DEV system ( http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com )

But some exceptions (data extracted from dev sitemaps), exemple :

  • wrong trim :

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6526] SEO - Fluctuation Issues - Product EOL Pages Issues - redirect in 301 to upper hierarchy level or new product
item.description:
Observations :

  • There is a fluctuation of our assortment of products over time due to product life circle.
  • Since Hybris implementation, this result into 10% of accessible indexed (by google, or reco engine) product pages that are redirected in 302 to the EOL page.
  • Google have and is crawling/indexing thoses pages.
  • Those products pages have and will accumulate over time "seo weight".
  • For February 2015 in CH, 9000 users have consulted at least one product page leading to an EOL page.
  • The landing page EOL have a bounce rate of 75%.

Impacts :

  • Google is wasting crawl time on 0 content pages.
  • We are not transmitting this weight to the new pages related to the EOL.
  • The number of 0 stock indexed product page are going to grow over years.
  • No SEO correction = Destroying/not transmitting the accumulated seo weight of those previously content filled pages.
  • No SEO correction is an equivalent of a failed SEO migration on a growing part of the website.
  • No correction equal a major lost of users during browsing.
  • We loose 75% of the users on this page (9000 user per month)

Demands :

  • When a product become EOL and :
    • we don't have a replacement product => Redirect in 301 to their upper category level url.
      Exemple (if this product is EOL) : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/16924407 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../c/cat-186834
    • we have a replacement for the product => Redirect in 301 to the replacement product url.
      Exemple (if this product is EOL) : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/16924407 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/new_productid_replacing_EOL
  • Inform the user :
    • if redirection on category page : display a popin showing this message
      "Unfortunately, the product you are looking for is end of life. We show you products from the same category."
    • if redirection on product page : display a popin showing this message
      "Unfortunately, the product you are looking for is end of life. We show you the replacement product."

Demands details :

  • If this demand go against usability request, it can be implemented only for bots (but it will still be 10x better than 80% of bounces rate on the EOL page).
  • Ideally, the redirection /p/old =301> /c/ should be handled at 100% by hybris like here : http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5960
  • Ideally, the redirection /p/old =301> /p/new should be provided by PIM through SAP, If not possible directly handle by Hybris with a connection on SAP raw data.
    this raw sap data is findable in this SAP view :

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6440] Make product punch-out-filter more robust
item.description:
DistProductPunchOutFilter is abstract and has the following attributes:

  • product
  • productHierarchy
    The two attributes are part of the unique key (unique="true") BUT they both are optional. Idea is to set one (product) OR the other (productHierachy).

To make the system more robust, we should introduce an intercepter that ensures that exactly one of the two attributes is given (not null).

Add a test class with the following test cases:

  • both attributes are null
  • both attributes are not null
  • product is not null and productHierarchy is null
  • product is null and productHierarchy is not null

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: added validate interceptor for product punchout filter. committed in trunk. ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6307] SEO - Duplication Issues - Pagination on Category pages
item.description:
Observations :

  • Since December 2014, category product results page are displayed with a pagination to display product :
    Exemple : On http://www.distrelec.ch/fr/Outils-et-mesure/Instruments-de-mesure/Oscilloscopes/Oscilloscopes-num%C3%A9riques-%C3%A0-m%C3%A9moire/c/cat-29061
    A link to every results pages is done :
    http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Components/Passive-Components/Resistors/Precision-Resistors/Precision-Resistors-SMD/Precision-Resistors-ERJL,-1210,-0-33-W,-1%-SMD/c/cat-322629&page=1
  • Those links lead to an http 400 for the bots
  • Those links are functional for the users (js).

Impacts :

  • We are wasting google bot crawl frame time on http 400 pages.
  • We don't let google bot discover the products inside category paginated pages.
  • We don't provide a relationship model between pagination pages and category pages.
  • When google is not crawling correctly the category he can't discover naturraly the products.

Demands :

  • Correct the pagination links on every category pages results.
    example : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629&page=1 (400) corrected into http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=1 (200)
  • Redirect in 301 the faulty category page to the right one.
    example : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629&page=1 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=1
  • Insert inside the <head> of category pages with multiple results pages "next/prev" meta tags (https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/1663744?hl=en)
    example :
    • For a category page without multiple results pages : no meta tags
    • For a category page, paginated as number 1 (distrelec.xx/*/c/id or http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat_id?page=1) :
      url : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629
      <link rel="next" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=2">
    • For a category page, paginated as number 2 (distrelec.xx/*/c/id?page=2) :
      url : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=2
      <link rel="prev" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629">
<link rel="next" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=3">
    • For a category page, paginated as number 3 (distrelec.xx/*/c/id?page=3) :
      url : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=3
      <link rel="prev" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=2">
<link rel="next" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=4">
    • For the last paginated page of a category (distrelec.xx/*/c/id?page=lastpage) :
      url : http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=lastpage
      <link rel="prev" href="http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=lastpageN-1">
  • Create a 301 redirection for the pagination "page=1" to the root.
    example :
    http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629?page=1 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/*/c/cat-322629

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6254] EOL // Wrong replacement product
item.description:
If an item has a sales status 60 (END OF LIFE) and we get a replacement product from the ERP (IF-01) then we are showing a warning message on top of the product page.

For example:
"The product Resistor SMD 15 Ohm 1210 PU=5000p., article number 725174 is end of life. You may order the successor product below."

If I call the EOL product directly through the URL (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Resistor-SMD-47-Ohm-1210-PU%3D5000-ST-Panasonic-Automotive-%26-Industrial-Systems-ERJP14F47R0U/p/11083319?replacementFor=11025585)
The we see the correct replacement page below the warning message

If I call the EOL product through the search then I get the same replacement product as the EOL product. (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=725180)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Neeraj,

Could you please provide me with a Status update there. Thanks in advance
"as discussed, Will gonna check the "replacement process" with Rafael .

Hi Neeraj

In my opinion with this url http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=725180 the replacement product is not loaded correctly. we display still the old product. In the searchpagecontroller we need to check if the requested product has a replacement and if so we need to redirect to the replacement product and load also the replacement product and not the requested product.

Cheers
Will
Ready for testing

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5858] Do not display empty categories / "Hiding" of empty categories
item.description:
As we have a very dynamic range of products, we have every now and then the case that categories are empty (be it because they have been deleted, all the articles are currently unavailable, etc).

In any case, these empty categories should never be displayed on the shop. So please implement a mechanism that hides empty categories so that they are not displayed anymore as long as they are empty.
item.summary: Do not display empty categories / "Hiding" of empty categories

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Raphi
Do you see any way to do this?
I think this won't be possible as lomg the mega flyout is a static element.

This is not possible. The only thing that we can do is that we check with a cronjob if there are categories that do not contain any products.
Please check that with Adi especially in point of performance.

Hi Adi,
do you have any idea to solve this?

Hi Daniela

I implemented the following logic:

When you would open this category http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/Sicherheit-%C3%9Cberwachung/c/cat-L3D_542673 with no product results inside, there would be a redirect to its super category http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/c/cat-L2D_542669.

This logic is working but I didnt commit yet. Would you like that I do this change? What about SEO? Are there any conflicts with this behaviour?

Cheers
Will

@Will : The logic have already been implemented here : http://jira.distrelec.com/browse/DISTRELEC-5960
Please read the tiquet and check with Francesco how to modify it to be available not only for bots but also for users.

Pierre
committed in v3.2. ready for test deployment.
Please test today, thx.

On my side it's ok.

Question : Who is in charge of the maintenance of the "super category pages" ?
The empy cat are redirected but, their empty links need to be removed too, exemple for
http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/c/cat-L2D_542669

Hi Pierre

There is a dedicated workflow for this: http://my.datwyler.biz/t/distrelec/inclusion-initiatives_projects/process/webclass/Pages/Home.aspx
If you ever have any changes, please refer to this.

In this specific case, it shows that the issue has not been really fixed, as we still display empty categories.
Please put remaining estimate for the fix.
As discussed, create new flag "doNotDispalyInFE" on category. Set flag to true by redirect action. Activate "dead" categories by a cronjob, which checks all deactivated categories once a month.
@Will : Since the fluctuation/bugs are quite frequent, if it's not too resources demanding, is it possible to run the cronjob every weeks ?

I we can do testing on Q, when I have implemented the job.

Cheers
Will

item.title: [DISTRELEC-5664] Use root attribute definition from XML instead of hardcoded whitelistedRootProductFeatures.txt
item.description:
Regarding J-W it seems to be possible to add the root attributes into the XML, too. This is like a "dynamic" whitelist.

@David: Shall we try this dynamic way - or shall we keep the existing solution with a hardcoded whitelist (in a textfile)?
item.summary: Use root attribute definition from XML instead of hardcoded whitelistedRootProductFeatures.txt

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The idea of the dynamic way is to add a meta-Attribute to the attributes and define directly from PIM "Root".

That's the nicest solution and my prefered one but I don't know what it means in term of effort.

I quickly reviewed the way how "allowed" root attributes are defined in the attribute definition section of the XML. Looks good.
The dynamic way (instead of a hardcoded list) could be implemented within 1 PT.

@Florian: I changed this ticket to a CR issue. Please decide whether you want to change this way detecting root attributes to a more flexible solution. From my point of view: It makes sense but has no priority since we have a working solution. Implementation can be done by a developer of your team or by myself.

When a PIM import starts, we read the content of whitelistedRootProductFeatures.txt into a list in the importContext. Instead of using this hardcoded list Distrelec wants to use a definition of root attributes defined by PIM itself. Please read attached doc of J-W and talk to him (or David) for details.

Background: During PIM import, we do NOT know which attributes are allowed to be assigned to the root-class ClassificationClass. As a result we had a huge list of more than 500 attributes assigned to the root-class. This has a HUGE performance impact. As a quick solution I introduced the file whitelistedRootProductFeatures.txt that contains a list of allowed root attributes.

Please add a SanityCheck (ask Raphael for details) to ensure there are no more than 55 attribute assignment for the root-class (current number is 51). This will alert Florian/Rafael in case the limit of 55 is exceeded.

Flexible search to be executed in the SanityCheck:

SELECT count(*)
FROM {ClassificationClass AS cc
JOIN ClassAttributeAssignment AS caa ON {cc.pk}={caa.classificationClass}}
WHERE {cc.code} = 'class-root'

I detected 2 new root attributes in the XML file:

  • unspsc15
  • eclass80

Since they are NOT whitelisted they have not been imported yet. I have now added the two attributes to the whitelist - see DISTRELEC-6112.

Hello Adrian,
so you added these 2 attributes into a txt file (whitelistedRootProductFeatures.txt).
Does it mean that our solution "Instead of using this hardcoded list Distrelec wants to use a definition of root attributes defined by PIM itself." is not yet implemented.
These 2 new attributes have the correct "ePlatform" value in PIM.

When is it possible to implement the automated update?
Thanks for Feedback.
@J-W: This ticket will bring an automatic "update". But it's not yet implemented. This ticket is only minor and more important issues exist . For details/timeline talk to Florian or Nabil.

Hi Adi,
could you check the implementation please.

Note: I kept the old implementation as well (based on the text file)

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6518] SEO - Sitemap - Exclusion exceptions for products
item.description:
Observations :

  • A pattern of destination url provided inside the products sitemap is not appropriate.
    example : http://www.distrelec.de/en/-----/p/30008263

Impacts :

  • When we provide wrong/useless url to the crawler we will waste crawl time frame and index wrong url, which is not the idea of a sitemap.
  • Currently there is 15k of this pattern inside the product sitemaps
  • Those wrong data create seo analitycs issue.

Demand :

  • Exclude all product url containing the pattern "-----".
  • Exclude all product url containing the pattern "/-/p/". (cf DISTRELEC-6547)

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Sitemap - Exclusion exceptions for products

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
As discussed with Francesco, this issue should be escalated higher (ERP, PIM & Hybris interconnexion and dependancies on exports which create empty products).
But meanwhile the fallback proposed in this tiquet seem to be the simplest way to solve the issue.

I'm checking the sales status information with Movex and SAP team because this product (and the other in the same status as well) is weird.
The sales status received from Movex (CH and AT) and SAP (DE) is 20
In the attachment the file containing the list of the erp_sales_status files received by SAP and Movex.

According with Ove answer and with the phone call we had together with Florian and Stefan Gunnars it seems that this product was a service+ item that has been created in SAP to be able to sell it and create an order.
So it seems that this product (and all the product like this) are dummy and are needed only to fulfill a service+ order.

For that reason we have to think about a way to avoid that these products are shown in the webshop.
An option that has been discussed with Florian and Stefan Gunnars is to use the field ZZPIM_RELEV in the MARA table.
The information contained into this field defines if a product is ONLY a service+ dummy item.

@Francesco : Please evaluate if it's preferable to have a rule that catch and ban the pattern "-----"
or a bigger static list (to maintain manually over time) of excluded pid inside the exclusion file.
(I still prefer the rule on the pattern, since it's less maintenance over time and not killing the perf on the exclusion).
Should be resolved in DISTRELEC-6641
Please check on the DEV system ( http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/sitemap_index.xml )

The problem is not corrected, it is modified.
The pattern to exclude now is "/-/p/".
Exemple :

  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11073218
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11073220
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11081002
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11089974
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11088204
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11088205
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11088206
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/-/p/11088208
    ...

Not ready for P
Will be moved to next sprint.
Check to do here by myself : http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/sitemap.xml.gz

Check done,

The rewriting have created a new pattern for those empty products, now they appear like these :

  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/de/p/11016457
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/p/11016457
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/fr/p/11016457
  • http://dev.distrelec-ch.distrelec.com/en/p/11016457

Please ban product inside sitemaps appearing like this PCRE regex patterns :
((/[a-z]{2}/)|/+)p/[0-9]+

=> Not ready for Q yet

I used the following regex pattern:

/(([a-z]{2}|-)/)?p/[0-9]+

this pattern will exclude the following URLs:

  • /xx/p/[0-9]+
  • /p/[0-9]+
  • /-/p/[0-9]+
will be ready on DEV system by tomorrow.
Ok great news !
